name: Ethanolamine (MEA)
discription: Ethanolamine (Monoethanolamine, MEA) is an organic chemical compound that is both a primary amine and a primary alcohol. It is a colorless, viscous liquid with an odor reminiscent of ammonia.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 61.1, Flash Point: 93°C, Boiling point: 170°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.2 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.454 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical MEA density is ~1.012 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index mistakenly placed. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.454; assuming this is as per table despite deviation from known data.), Surface Tension (25°C): 40 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a pH adjuster, emulsifier, and in the synthesis of various pharmaceutical intermediates and APIs. Can be used to form salts with acidic drugs to improve solubility or stability.
other_industries: Gas scrubbing (removal of CO2 and H2S from natural gas and refinery streams), intermediate for surfactants and detergents, textile processing, metalworking fluids, corrosion inhibitors, cement grinding aid, production of ethylenediamine.

name: Diethanolamine (DEA)
discription: Diethanolamine is an organic compound that is both a secondary amine and a diol. Like other alkanolamines, DEA is used as a surfactant and a corrosion inhibitor. It is a colorless, viscous liquid or crystalline solid depending on temperature.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 105.1, Flash Point: 137°C, Boiling point: 268°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 1.5 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.477 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical DEA density is ~1.09 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.477; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 44 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless sticky liquid or crystals.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as an emulsifier, pH adjuster, and solubilizer in pharmaceutical formulations, particularly topical preparations. Used in the synthesis of pharmaceutical intermediates. Regulatory scrutiny exists due to potential for nitrosamine formation.
other_industries: Gas sweetening (removal of acid gases), intermediate for surfactants (e.g., cocamide DEA), detergents, textile finishing agents, agricultural chemicals, corrosion inhibitors, cutting oils, cosmetics (emulsifier, foaming agent).

name: Triethanolamine (TEA)
discription: Triethanolamine is a tertiary amine and a triol. It is a viscous organic compound that is both a tertiary amine and a triol. It is a colorless to pale yellow liquid with a slight ammoniacal odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 149.2, Flash Point: 185°C, Boiling point: 360°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0 (likely <0.01 mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.485 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical TEA density is ~1.124 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.485; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 55 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: colorless to yellowish viscous liquid.
food_idustry: Permitted as an indirect food additive (e.g., in adhesives or coatings in contact with food), pH adjuster in some food processing applications, with limitations.
pharmaceutical_industry: Widely used as an emulsifier, pH adjuster, buffering agent, and solubilizer in pharmaceutical and cosmetic formulations, especially creams, lotions, and gels. Forms stable emulsions and adjusts pH effectively.
other_industries: Cement grinding aid, surfactant production, corrosion inhibitor, dispersing agent for dyes and pigments, textile processing, metalworking fluids, cosmetics (emulsifier, pH adjuster), photographic developing solutions.

name: Methyl Monoethanolamine (MMEA)
discription: N-Methylethanolamine (Methyl Monoethanolamine) is an alkanolamine that is a precursor in the synthesis of various chemicals. It is a colorless liquid.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 75.109, Flash Point: 73°C, Boiling point: 159°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.5 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.439 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical MMEA density is ~0.935 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.439; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): / (Not provided). Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as an intermediate in the synthesis of pharmaceuticals, such as antihistamines and local anesthetics. Also as a pH adjuster or buffering agent.
other_industries: Intermediate for surfactants, textile chemicals, corrosion inhibitors, and coatings. Used in gas treating (CO2 removal), and as a catalyst in polyurethane foam production.

name: N-Methyldiethanolamine (MDEA)
discription: N-Methyldiethanolamine is a tertiary amine and a diol. It is a colorless to pale yellow liquid commonly used in gas treating applications.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 119.162, Flash Point: 137°C, Boiling point: 243°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.01 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.4675-1.4695 (these values resemble Refractive Index more than density; typical MDEA density is ~1.038 g/cm³; Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is given as a range; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): / (Not provided). Physical Properties: Colorless or dark yellow oily liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as an intermediate in the synthesis of certain pharmaceutical compounds. Also, it can function as a pH buffering agent or catalyst.
other_industries: Primarily used in gas sweetening processes for selective removal of H2S from gas streams containing CO2; catalyst for polyurethane foams; intermediate for fabric softeners, lubricants, and surfactants; corrosion inhibitor.

name: N,N-Dimethylethanolamine (DMEA)
discription: N,N-Dimethylethanolamine (Dimethylethanolamine, DMAE) is an organic compound that is both a tertiary amine and a primary alcohol. It is a colorless to light yellow liquid with a fishy or ammonia-like odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 89.136, Flash Point: 40.6°C, Boiling point: 135°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 3.4 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.433 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical DMEA density is ~0.886 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.433; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 30.6 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Transparent to light yellow liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a precursor in the synthesis of various pharmaceuticals (e.g., antihistamines, local anesthetics). Also used in some dietary supplements and topical preparations marketed for cognitive function or skin firming, though scientific evidence varies.
other_industries: Catalyst in the production of polyurethane foams and epoxy resins; intermediate for ion exchange resins, water treatment chemicals, corrosion inhibitors, and coatings; pH control agent.

name: N,N-Dimethylacetamide (DMAC)
discription: N,N-Dimethylacetamide is an organic compound, a colorless, high-boiling, polar aprotic solvent. It is miscible with water and many organic solvents.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 87.1, Flash Point: 66°C, Boiling point: 166°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.9 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.436 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical DMAC density is ~0.937 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.436; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 25 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent for reactions in pharmaceutical synthesis, particularly for compounds with low solubility in other solvents. Used in the production of antibiotics and other APIs. Solvent for polymer dissolution in drug delivery system manufacturing.
other_industries: Solvent for resins, polymers (e.g., polyacrylonitrile, PVC, polyamides), and synthetic fibers (e.g., Spandex); paint stripper; catalyst in some reactions; solvent for electrolytes.

name: N,N-Dimethylformamide (DMF)
discription: N,N-Dimethylformamide is an organic compound, a common polar aprotic solvent. It is a colorless liquid miscible with water and the majority of organic liquids, possessing a faint amine odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 73.1, Flash Point: 58°C, Boiling point: 152.8°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.802 (likely mmHg at 20°C), Density (20°C): 1.4275 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical DMF density is ~0.944 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.4275; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 26 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Widely used as a solvent in the synthesis of pharmaceuticals due to its high dielectric constant and ability to dissolve a wide range of organic and inorganic compounds. Used in peptide synthesis and for processing polymers for medical applications.
other_industries: Industrial solvent for polymers (e.g., polyacrylonitrile, PVC), resins, and synthetic fibers; solvent in chemical reactions (e.g., Vilsmeier-Haack reaction); paint stripper; production of pesticides and adhesives.

name: Diethylenetriamine (DETA)
discription: Diethylenetriamine is an organic compound, a common member of the polyethylene amine family. It is a colorless to pale yellow, hygroscopic liquid with an ammonia-like odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 103.17, Flash Point: 102°C, Boiling point: 207°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.08 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.484 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical DETA density is ~0.95 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.484; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): / (Not provided). Physical Properties: Light yellow liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as an intermediate in the synthesis of certain pharmaceutical compounds and chelating agents.
other_industries: Curing agent for epoxy resins; intermediate for chelating agents (e.g., DTPA), surfactants, fabric softeners, corrosion inhibitors, fuel additives, and asphalt additives; ion exchange resins; solvent.

name: Triethylenetetramine (TETA)
discription: Triethylenetetramine is an organic compound from the polyethylene amine family. It is a colorless to yellowish oily liquid with a strong ammonia-like odor. Commercial TETA is often a mixture of linear, branched, and cyclic isomers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 146.23, Flash Point: 143.3°C, Boiling point: 267°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.5 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.49 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical TETA density is ~0.98 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.49; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 40.4 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless or slightly yellow, viscous liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a chelating agent (e.g., TETA dihydrochloride for Wilson's disease to remove copper). Intermediate in the synthesis of some pharmaceutical agents.
other_industries: Curing agent for epoxy resins; intermediate for chelating agents, corrosion inhibitors, fuel additives, surfactants, and asphalt additives; lube oil additives; ion exchange resins.

name: DL-1-Amino-2-propanol (MIPA)
discription: DL-1-Amino-2-propanol (Monoisopropanolamine) is an alkanolamine used as an emulsifier, stabilizer, and chemical intermediate. It's a colorless to slightly yellow liquid with a mild ammoniacal odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 75.11, Flash Point: 73.89°C, Boiling point: 159.4°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.9 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.4479 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical MIPA density is ~0.96 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.4479; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 35.7 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless or slightly yellow liquid. There is a slight smell of ammonia.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as an emulsifying agent, pH adjuster, and stabilizer in pharmaceutical creams and lotions. Intermediate in the synthesis of various APIs.
other_industries: Emulsifier and dispersing agent for cosmetics, metalworking fluids, and agricultural chemicals; corrosion inhibitor; neutralizing agent; intermediate for surfactants and textile auxiliaries.

name: 783 Isophorone (IP)
discription: Isophorone (3,5,5-Trimethyl-2-cyclohexen-1-one) is an α,β-unsaturated cyclic ketone. It is a colorless to yellowish liquid with a characteristic peppermint-like odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 138.2, Flash Point: 85°C, Boiling point: 213°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.4 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.484 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical Isophorone density is ~0.923 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.484; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 32 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Light yellow liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as an intermediate in the synthesis of some pharmaceutical compounds. Can be a solvent in specific formulation processes.
other_industries: Solvent for paints, lacquers, varnishes, inks, and adhesives; intermediate in the synthesis of isophorone diamine (IPDA, a curing agent for epoxy resins), isophorone diisocyanate (IPDI, for polyurethanes), pesticides, and fragrances; leveling agent in coatings.

name: N-Methyl-2-pyrrolidone (NMP)
discription: N-Methyl-2-pyrrolidone is a polar aprotic solvent with high solvency and low volatility. It is a colorless liquid with a mild amine odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 99.13, Flash Point: 91°C, Boiling point: 204.3°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.3 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.479 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical NMP density is ~1.028 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.479; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 33.7 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorlessclearoilliquid,slightlyaminesmell.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent in drug synthesis, purification, and formulation. Particularly useful for dissolving poorly soluble APIs. Solvent for transdermal drug delivery systems. Regulatory bodies are increasing scrutiny due to reproductive toxicity concerns.
other_industries: Solvent for polymers (e.g., engineering plastics, PVC), resins, and coatings; paint stripper; degreasing agent in electronics industry; extraction solvent in petrochemical processing (e.g., BTX extraction); lithium-ion battery manufacturing.

name: 4-Hydroxy-4-methyl-2-pentanone (DAA)
discription: 4-Hydroxy-4-methyl-2-pentanone, commonly known as Diacetone Alcohol, is an organic compound that is both a ketone and an alcohol. It is a colorless liquid with a mild, pleasant odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 116.2, Flash Point: 62°C, Boiling point: 168°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 1.2 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.424 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical DAA density is ~0.938 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.424; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 31 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent or intermediate in the synthesis of certain pharmaceutical compounds.
other_industries: Solvent for cellulose acetate, nitrocellulose, resins, oils, fats, and waxes; component in lacquers, coatings, and paint strippers; hydraulic brake fluids; intermediate for mesityl oxide and MIBK; extraction solvent.

name: 4-Methyl-2-pentanone (MIBK)
discription: 4-Methyl-2-pentanone, also known as Methyl Isobutyl Ketone, is an organic compound used as a solvent. It is a colorless liquid with a faint, sweet, ketone-like odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 100.2, Flash Point: 15.6°C, Boiling point: 117°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 2.1 (likely mmHg at 20C based on other values), Density (20°C): 1.395 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical MIBK density is ~0.802 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.395; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 24 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as an extraction solvent for antibiotics and other pharmaceuticals. Solvent in pharmaceutical manufacturing processes.
other_industries: Solvent for nitrocellulose, lacquers, resins, gums, and coatings; extraction solvent for metals (e.g., gold, uranium); dewaxing agent for mineral oils; production of adhesives and rubber chemicals; denaturant for alcohol.

name: 2,6-Dimethyl-4-heptanone (DIBK)
discription: 2,6-Dimethyl-4-heptanone, also known as Diisobutyl Ketone, is an organic compound used as a solvent. It is a colorless liquid with a mild, sweet odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 142.2, Flash Point: 49°C, Boiling point: 169°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 1 (likely mmHg), Density (20°C): 1.412 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical DIBK density is ~0.808 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.412; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 25 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent in some pharmaceutical extraction or manufacturing processes where a less volatile ketone is required.
other_industries: Solvent for nitrocellulose, vinyl resins, lacquers, coatings, and adhesives; extraction solvent for oils, fats, and waxes; component in specialty cleaning formulations; intermediate in organic synthesis.

name: Methyl Isopropyl Ketone (MIPK)
discription: Methyl Isopropyl Ketone (3-Methyl-2-butanone) is an aliphatic ketone. It is a colorless liquid with a characteristic ketone odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 86.13, Flash Point: -3°C, Boiling point: 95°C, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 1.3 (likely mmHg at 20C based on other values), Density (20°C): 1.3887 (this value seems high for density g/cm³, typical MIPK density is ~0.805 g/cm³; this might be a typo or Refractive Index. Table's column heading is Density (20120°C) and value is 1.3887; assuming this is as per table despite deviation.), Surface Tension (25°C): 26 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless to pale yellow liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Can be used as a solvent or intermediate in pharmaceutical synthesis.
other_industries: Solvent for resins, lacquers, coatings, and adhesives; intermediate in organic synthesis; extraction solvent.
